snippet: In one handwritten letter, an inmate wrote that in solitary confinement, the mind “rots” with disturbing thoughts.
abstract: Trove of letters sent to the New York Civil Liberties Union from more than 100 inmates in solitary confinement in the New York State prison system vividly detail the psychological effects of long-term solitary confinement; NYCLU, which corresponded with the men to bolster its attempts to curtail the practice of solitary confinement, plans to publish a report on its findings from the correspondence project.
lead_paragraph: In one handwritten letter, an inmate wrote that in solitary confinement, the mind “rots” with disturbing thoughts.

headline.seo: Prisoner Letters Offer Glimpses of Life in Solitary Confinement
headline.main: Prisoners’ Letters Offer a Window Into Lives Spent Alone in Tiny Cells
